The Fund maintains relationships with a handful of brokers and liquidity providers that offer investors instant access to liquidity, including overnight and weekend liquidity when banks are closed. These relationships include Wintermute, with additional institutional liquidity providers currently in final discussions to deepen liquidity across the fund.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)

At launch, the Fund will accept fiat subscriptions as well as USDC / USDT and major cryptocurrencies. The Fund will also accept Sky and USDS.

17. What are your future development plans for the product?

A. We are in discussions with our regulator to find ways to ensure RBILL can be more interoperable in DeFi and to allow for secondary transfers. We are looking to build and support an RWA ecosystem in which RWAs can be utilized within DeFi. This will include partnerships with, or launching of our own, DeFi RWA-focused applications; management of RWA tokens on behalf of investors; and creation of RWA DeFi strategies.

B. Outside of RBILL, Realize is an RWA tokenization platform which is capable of supporting additional RWA tokens. Realize currently has plans to launch two additional tokenized funds, and is in talks with several key players (both local to UAE and abroad) to tokenize further assets.

At Realize, we see the tokenization of RWAs as the first step towards building a truly global, immersive, free and fair economy. In order to realize this vision, tokenized RWAs must have additional utility along with the ability to be traded on secondary markets.

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates:

The Fund is an authorized fund, structured as an open-ended investment company within ADGMs Financial Services Regulatory Authority. The licensed Fund Manager operates within ADGM and the regulated Administrator operates within Singapore with agreement to administer a fund in ADGM.

2. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

ADGM (Abu Dhabi Global Market) in Abu Dhabi, UAE.

3. What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold?

Realize T-BILLS Fund (OEIC) Ltd has been incorporated under registration 20534 and authorized as a fund by ADGM under referent F-0126, a copy of the authorisation letter can be shared privately.

4. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness.

The Fund has been created with the sole purpose to support the launch of the RBILL token in a regulated and transparent manner. The Fund will not issue any separate or additional products to its investors.

The Fund is managed by NeoVision, a licensed investment manager headquartered in UAE. Ascent Fund Services Limited is the regulated Administrator who will calculate the daily NAV and perform daily subscriptions and redemptions.

Following the RBILL minting process, investors’ tokens are provided directly to the investor and are not retained by Realize, the Fund or any of its affiliates, unless the investor chooses to use a full custody service provider (partnerships to be announced shortly).

Shares in US Treasury ETFs are acquired and custodied through our broker, Interactive Brokers LLC. Additional regulated brokers and custodians of the ETFs will be added in the future. Realize does not hold or retain any rights to the Fund’s assets and the Fund’s assets are not recognised on Realize’s or the Fund Manager’s balance sheet. Furthermore, no operational capital of Realize or its affiliates are commingled with the Fund’s assets (digital or otherwise). Assets are also not leveraged or managed within an investment strategy which ensures the assets are not at risk.

In addition to the above, the Fund is subject to an annual external audit, provided by Grant Thornton. This ensures that the management and administration of the Fund is in line with its legal and regulatory requirements.

We are working with Chainlink and the Fund Administrator to implement off-chain proof of reserves and are exploring implementing a transparency council which would include a number of trusted partners who would have view access of the asset accounts for the Fund. We would be happy to add members of SparkDAO / MakerDAO to this council.

5. What rights do tokenholders have?

The rights of token holders are entrenched in the Articles of Association of the Fund, of which a contractual nexus exists between the Fund and the token holders. Any subsequent transferee of a token, or a fraction of a token, will sign customary documents adhering to the various Fund documents binding it to the obligations thereunder and affording it their rights therein. In summary:

  1. The tokens afford the token holder a proportionate share in the assets of the Fund (in the same manner as participating shares would afford the holder a right in the assets of the fund in a traditional structure).
  2. The tokens may be subscribed for (minted) and redeemed (burned) in accordance with the Fund documents.
  3. Subscribers sign a token purchase agreement that will reflect substantially the form of a fund subscription agreement as well as containing all other information necessary in connection with the issuing of the investor’s tokens.

6. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?

Realize and its officers have maintained a clean legal record, with no history of criminal or legal enforcement actions.

7. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO:

Our relationship with MakerDAO and its officers is free of any conflicts or potential issues.

8. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product:

Neither Realize nor the Fund is qualified to provide tax advice. We kindly recommend that potential investors into the Fund seek qualified tax advice to understand any current or potential future tax implications before investing in $RBILL tokens.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark:

The Fund is due to launch in October 2024 and as such we are unable to provide any historical performance records relative to benchmark.

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports.

A daily NAV report will be issued by the Fund Administrator. We are also currently working towards Chainlink Proof of Reserves adoption together with a Transparency Committee which could include members of SparkDAO / MakerDAO. The Transparency Committee is planned to have view-access of both bank and custody accounts.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product:

Ascent has been appointed by the Fund as the fund administrator, pursuant to the terms of the administrative services agreement. The Administrator is responsible for providing services required in connection with the Fund’s operations, including (i) calculating the net asset value of the Fund; (ii) verifying the identity of investors for the purposes of anti-money laundering regulations; and (iii) preparing and submitting to the Fund and the Fund Manager all ancillary documentation that are used for the annual audit and the preparation of financial statements. The annual financial statements will be prepared in line with Ascent’s policies and procedures, and will be audited by Grant Thornton.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product:

Our product is built using Solidity for Ethereum Virtual Machines (EVMs) but is designed with future scalability in mind, as we plan to extend support to non-EVM virtual machines. The core of the system operates through a series of smart contracts that manage tokenization, user interactions, price oracles, and whitelisting functions, all while ensuring high security and compliance standards.

At the heart of our system is the TokenManager contract, which holds the core logic for both the current and future tokens issued on the platform. The TokenManager contract orchestrates essential functions like minting and burning tokens, managing pricing through oracles, and interacting with permissioned lists of users. The modular nature of TokenManager allows the system to be easily extendable, making it adaptable to new types of tokens or evolving business logic.

Supporting the TokenManager are a series of contracts designed for specific purposes. Hub.sol handles user requests for minting and redeeming tokens, ensuring that collateral is deposited and tokens are issued appropriately. The Hub contract serves as the central point for token operations, coordinating between various contracts in the system, including pricing and whitelisting mechanisms.

The ListAggregator.sol contract ensures that users meet all necessary criteria by checking multiple whitelists, providing an aggregated view of allowed or disallowed accounts. This is critical in ensuring compliance with various KYC and AML regulations, as different token providers may have specific rules for whitelisted addresses. Administrators can add or remove users from these lists using the ManagedList.sol contract, which allows flexibility in managing permissions.

The TokenPrice.sol contract acts as a price oracle, allowing specific operators to adjust token prices within predefined limits. This is key for ensuring that the system remains adaptive to market conditions while maintaining strict control over price changes. The use of price oracles ensures that token minting and redemption operations always occur at a fair value, protecting both the platform and its users from price manipulation or errors.

One of the standout features of our system is its ability to handle multiple tokens and operations simultaneously. The Proxy.sol contract provides upgradability, ensuring that the system can evolve without disrupting existing operations. This is particularly important for a platform dealing with real-world assets (RWAs), as regulations and business requirements may change over time.

A crucial aspect of the Realize platform is its integration with Fireblocks, which plays a key role in securing all on-chain operations. Every critical operation, from minting and burning tokens to handling sensitive user-related functions, is tied to a Fireblocks MPC (Multi-Party Computation) Vault. This means that no single entity or person can execute an operation on their own; instead, it requires approval from multiple authorized parties, making the system more secure and reducing the risk of unauthorized actions.

The Fireblocks Vault ensures that all actions require a series of cryptographic signatures from a committee before execution. This process not only protects the system from insider threats but also provides a transparent approval chain for every transaction. Every operation is logged and requires multiple approvals, ensuring that no unauthorized action can take place.

We will further enhance security by incorporating Chainlink Proof of Reserve (PoR), which ensures that the collateral backing the tokens is fully transparent. By integrating PoR, users and regulators can verify in real-time that the system is appropriately collateralized, thus enhancing trust in the platform.

From an operational perspective, Realize connects to Ascent Group’s systems, which handle the onboarding and KYC processes. Ascent’s technology, including its global ID coverage and automated transaction monitoring, ensures that users are onboarded quickly and securely. All user information remains confidential, and Realize does not store any sensitive personal data. Ascent’s systems, integrated with One Constellation, allow for real-time access to fund data, ensuring transparency for both fund managers and investors.

By combining the security and transparency provided by Fireblocks, Chainlink PoR, and Ascent’s onboarding technology, Realize offers a secure, compliant, and scalable solution for managing tokenized real-world assets. The integration of both on-chain and off-chain security measures ensures that users can confidently participate in the platform, knowing that their assets and personal data are fully protected.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

The smart contracts for our product underwent a comprehensive audit by Zokyo Security in July 2024. The audit yielded a high score of 98/100, with no critical or high-severity issues. All identified medium and low-severity issues were resolved, and the audit covered key areas, including test coverage (97.27%), security against reentrancy, and overall adherence to industry best practices. The audit report confirmed that our contracts are well-crafted, organized, and secure for handling token minting and redemption processes backed by real-world assets.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs:

The team behind Realize has been involved in DAOs since early 2020. The primary experience has been in establishing the legal framework in establishing a Marshall Island DAO and guiding the process of establishing and getting community-approval for establishing the DAO. In addition to that, the Realize ecosystem team is in close contact with several major DAOs to invest into and diversify their treasury into the Fund. We expect to go through several other DAO governance processes to allocate part of the treasury of those DAOs to the Fund in the coming weeks.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?

Realize is an RWA tokenization, building out a range of tokenized regulated fund products, bringing yield-bearing assets on-chain and making them fully compatible and usable within Web3. As part of this ecosystem, Realize will launch a utility token in Q4 of this year. Realize is entirely self-funded and has no external investors, making it a pure token distribution that will be maximally community-oriented and aligned.

Unlike other RWA ecosystems, where the token is a limited governance token with no real rights or participation in the success of the ecosystem, the Realize token will be deeply embedded in the Realize platform to directly benefit token holders from the growth and success of the Realize RWA ecosystem. In addition to that, token holders can unlock various rewards, access premium features, fee rebates and actively participate in governance decisions. It serves as a key driver of engagement within the ecosystem, encouraging active involvement and long-term commitment from the community.

We take great inspiration from the incredible success of $MKR (now $SKY) and the MakerDAO governance process and community and want to work together to build the future of finance on-chain. Realize proposes to offer MakerDAO / SparkDAO up to a 5% token allocation and airdrop to $SKY holders. Details of the token airdrop and distribution will be discussed by both communities.

Apart from the token allocation, the Realize team is very happy to work closely with the MakerDAO / SparkDAO teams on future products and tokenized assets. In addition to that, we are happy to work closely on regulatory support in Abu Dhabi and the UAE, and helping the team with any matters related to becoming operational, domiciled or even regulated in the UAE. We are also happy to use our network of investors, policy makers and partners to support the SKY ecosystem.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

Realize serves as the gateway to an expansive DeFi ecosystem composed of a diverse range of dApps, enabling users to unlock the full potential of their investments in tokenized RWAs. Unlike competitors who restrict tokenization to isolated silos, Realize aims in the future to integrate these tokenized assets into a seamless and interconnected environment, allowing them to be used as collateral for additional yield-generating opportunities across multiple dApps within a regulatory compliant environment.

The Realize ecosystem team is currently in close discussions with several major L1 Blockchains to offer the tokenized $RBILL on their network and to partner with major DeFi applications within the ecosystem to accept $RBILL as collateral for trading pairs, collateral-backed lending protocols and more. We will work towards $RBILL being accepted as a secure form of collateral across all major L1 Blockchains.

Through Realize’s institutional-grade DeFi platforms, investors holding tokenized assets gain access to a wide range of opportunities to generate additional yield:

Realize: Realize is a cutting-edge tokenization platform that serves as the gateway for RWAs into the broader DeFi ecosystem. By seamlessly bridging traditional assets with blockchain technology, Realize empowers investors to tokenize and unlock the full potential of their assets, providing access to DeFi applications and opportunities that drive liquidity, yield generation, and enhanced financial flexibility.

Deepr Finance: Deepr Finance is a DeFi platform built on IOTA EVM that enables users to lend and borrow digital assets without the need for intermediaries. Users can supply their assets to the platform, earning interest on their deposits, while borrowers can take out loans by providing collateral. This creates a permissionless, transparent, and highly accessible financial ecosystem that promotes financial inclusion and innovation. Deepr Finance is a fork of the battle-tested Compound protocol and has been audited by Hashex and Sherlock. [status: launched on IOTA EVM]

Virtue: Virtue is an innovative, over-collateralized stablecoin borrowing platform, offering 0% interest rates and leveraging multi-collateral deposits to enhance the borrowing experience. As an official fork of the Liquity protocol, Virtue provides a stable, cost-efficient loan solution, ensuring transparency, decentralization, and diversified collateral options. [status: launching soon]

Pools: Pools is an advanced DEX, designed to enhance multi-token and weighted liquidity with its innovative Balancer V2 fork. Offering customizable pool configurations, index tracking products, and a liquidity bootstrapping launch pad, Pools delivers a flexible DeFi experience. [status: launching soon]

We are actively developing partnerships with additional dApps and will continue releasing them over time to further grow our DeFi ecosystem and provide exceptional value to our users. We prioritize regular audits and uphold stringent security standards to ensure the highest level of trust and protection for our investors.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

Realize is in the process of setting up and tokenizing several new high-yield regulated funds, including a trade finance fund and UAE real estate fund. The Realize team is working on a range of RWA-centric applications which will increase the utility, collateralization and compatibility of tokenized assets within DeFi.

In particular we are interested in partnering with SparkDAO, Steakhouse and related parties to accept $RBILL as collateral in some of their existing and new Vaults (e.g. on Morpho).

We would love to partner with the SparkDAO and Sub-DAO teams to bring these products to market, and are interested in pursuing joint ventures.

VII. Supplementary Documents

The team will provide the following documents via private email:

  • Fund Authorization Letter by ADGM
  • ADGM Legal White Paper
  • ADGM Fund Registry Extract
  • Shareholding Structure of the Fund
  • Articles of Association
  • Fund Commercial License

item.title: Sorry, but how can I trust Sky or Spark?
item.dc:creator: yousef
item.description:
Hello Spark.fi team and community,

I’m considering depositing a significant amount of DAI into the Spark.fi protocol, but before doing so, I’d appreciate some clarification on several important points to ensure the safety and security of my funds. I hope you can provide clear answers and address any concerns that other potential users like myself might have. Here are my key questions:

  1. How is the security of my DAI deposit ensured?
    What mechanisms are in place to prevent the theft or loss of funds while interacting with the Spark.fi protocol? Are there any smart contract audits or insurance policies in place to mitigate potential risks?
  2. What happens if the website or protocol goes down?
    In the unlikely event that Spark.fi becomes unavailable due to technical issues, cyber-attacks, or even a complete shutdown, what will happen to my deposited DAI? Will I still be able to access and withdraw my funds through alternate means (e.g., interacting directly with the smart contract)?
  3. Are there KYC (Know Your Customer) requirements?
    Does Spark.fi have any policies requiring KYC verification for users? If so, at what stage is it mandatory? This is crucial to understand from both a compliance and privacy perspective.
  4. Can my wallet be frozen or restricted?
    Under what circumstances, if any, could Spark.fi or any associated entity freeze, restrict, or block access to my wallet? For example, would compliance with regulatory requests or suspicious activity trigger such actions?
  5. What are the risks associated with depositing into the Spark.fi protocol?
    While I understand that all DeFi protocols carry inherent risks, could you outline the specific risks that are most relevant to Spark.fi? Are there any particular vulnerabilities users should be aware of?
  6. How is governance handled?
    Does Spark.fi have a governance model where users can vote on decisions? How decentralized is the protocol’s decision-making process, and how can I stay informed of governance updates or participate in governance myself?
  7. Is there a withdrawal limit or fee structure?
    What are the withdrawal policies in terms of limits, fees, or delays? Are there any situations where withdrawals might be temporarily paused?
  8. How are interest rates or yields determined?
    Could you explain how yields are calculated on DAI deposits and what factors might affect the return on investment? Are these yields subject to significant fluctuation?
  9. What recourse is available in case of loss?
    In the unfortunate event of a hack, exploit, or catastrophic failure of the protocol, is there any recourse for recovering lost funds? Does Spark.fi have any protection funds, insurance mechanisms, or partnerships that users should be aware of?
  10. How can I monitor the health of the protocol?
    Are there any recommended tools or dashboards I should use to track the performance and security of the protocol? What should I watch for in terms of metrics to assess its ongoing reliability?

I believe these questions are critical for anyone considering a substantial DAI deposit into Spark.fi or any DeFi protocol, and I hope to receive detailed responses to make an informed decision.

Thank you in advance for your time and assistance. I’m looking forward to your insights and any advice from fellow community members as well!

Best regards,

## I. PRODUCT SUMMARY

  1. Project Name: Delubac Asset Management x Ledgity

  2. Product Name: Delubac Short Duration US Government Bonds (“LUSDC”)

  3. Product Type / Underlying Asset: Short Duration U.S. Treasury Bills

  4. Issuer Jurisdiction: France

  5. Product Website: https://ledgity.finance/

  6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact:

  • Name: Pierre Yves Dittlot

    • Title: CEO, Ledgity, the issuer
    • Email: py@ledgity.com
    • Twitter & Telegram: @pydittlot / @pierreyves98

  • Name: Benoit Vesco

    • Title: Président Delubac Asset Management
    • Email: bvesco@delubac-am.fr

## II. COMPANY DETAILS

1. Company Description

Delubac Asset Management and Ledgity are pleased to submit our joint proposal for the Spark Tokenization Grand Prix. Our partnership is uniquely positioned to deliver the best solution for Spark and Sky ecosystem with a balanced approach to liquidity and capital efficiency, leveraging our expertise in blockchain technology, asset management, and financial innovation.

Delubac Asset Management is the asset management firm of the Bank Delubac & Cie founded in 1924. Delubac AM offers a suite of investment funds from monetary to equity and corporate bonds. Learn more about Delubac & Cie here.

Delubac Asset Management is authorized and regulated in France by the Financial Markets Authority, under approval number GP 00009, dated March 31, 2000.

Role of the bank Delubac & Cie in supporting Web3 companies :

  • Active support for innovative projects in the Web3 and blockchain ecosystem.
  • Continuous adaptation of products and services to meet sector developments.
  • Active member of ADAN (Association for the Development of Digital Assets).
  • Participation in numerous events, Web3 meet-ups.
  • Priority to Security: Guarantee that all banking services are not only operational but also fully secure.

Ledgity, based in France and regulated by French Financial Market Authority (AMF) as Digital Asset Service Provider, offers yield solutions on stablecoin backed by RWA. It is designed to be the cornerstone for scalable and efficient yield solutions, building the next generation of financial infrastructure to improve market efficiency, transparency, and financial inclusion. Learn more about Ledgity here.

2. Key Personnel Biographies

Joël-Alexis Bialkiewicz, Managing partner of the Bank Delubac & Cie

Joël-Alexis Bialkiewicz, managing partner of Banque Delubac & Cie, is a French banker known for his drive to innovate and undertake new ventures. A software engineering specialist, holding a master’s degree in algorithmics and a PhD in theoretical computer science from the artificial intelligence division of LIP6, he has been a Bitcoin miner since 2011 and founded the mobile payment startup DeluPay.

After completing his studies in 2010, he joined his father, Serge Bialkiewicz, at Banque Delubac & Cie, alongside Jean-Michel Samuel-Delubac, the grandson of the bank’s founder. Under his leadership, the bank’s activities diversified, particularly in corporate banking and transactions with complex countries. In 2022, the bank became the first French bank authorized to handle crypto-assets for its clients, following its registration as a PSAN (Digital Asset Service Provider).

As Banque Delubac & Cie celebrates its 100th anniversary this year, Joël-Alexis Bialkiewicz’s contribution to its modernization takes on its full significance.

Benoit Vesco, Président of Delubac AM

Benoît began his career in 1997 at Meeschaert as a bond manager. He was quickly promoted to Director of Fixed Income Management and then General Manager. Benoît joined Delubac Asset Management as President in December 2022.
Benoît holds a master’s degree in finance from ESCP, a degree in actuarial science from CNAM, is a member of the French Society of Financial Analysts, and is certified as a Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst.

Aurélien Buffault, Director of fixed income management

Aurélien, a graduate of Neoma Business School, CIIA, and CAIA, has more than twenty years of experience in the fixed income markets. He began his career in the actuarial and asset management department at Banque Dexia Crédit Local in 2001, and later worked at an institutional organization (AVA - Assurances Vieillesse des Artisans) as a fixed income manager until 2006. Aurélien then joined Meeschaert Asset Management, where he stayed for 17 years and eventually rose to the position of Director of Fixed Income Management.
In March 2023, Aurélien joined Delubac Asset Management as the Director of Fixed Income Management.

Pierre-Yves Dittlot, CEO & Founder of Ledgity

Specialized in the Asset Management and Private Banking industry, Pierre-Yves Dittlot has held several positions over the past 18 years as fund manager and CIO for asset management company, private bank and family office. Passionate about finance and technology, he founded Ledgity to drive the innovation at the convergence between DeFi and TradFi. In 2020, he collaborated with the Central Bank of Lithuania on a tokenization platform (proof of concept) for shares of investment funds. His mission, with Ledgity, is to contribute to modernize the world of wealth management, blending expertise in blockchain, digital assets, and financial markets.

3. Team size

The team combines the resources of Delubac AM and Ledgity.

  • Delubac AM:

  • Ledgity

4. Years in Operation:

  • Bank Delubac & Cie: ~100 year
  • Ledgity: 4 years

## III. PRODUCT INFORMATION

1. Describe the product:

Investment Strategy

LUSDC provides access to short-term U.S. Treasury Bills, aiming to generate current income while maintaining liquidity and principal stability. Its target returns are aligned with the federal funds rate.

The portfolio is managed by Delubac Asset Management, a regulated asset management company owned by the Bank Delubac & Cie. Aurélien Buffault is the Portfolio Manager responsible for executing the mandate. He brings decades of investing experience managing assets for institutions.

Legal Structure

LUSDC is a digital asset backed by the portfolio of short-term U.S. Treasury Bills. The funds are segregated from Ledgity Company through a Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV), which assigns Delubac AM the mandate to manage the T-Bills portfolio. This SPV is created specifically and exclusively for this application.

Fund Mechanics

Investors can deposit USDC into the dedicated Ledgity Vault, structured as a loan to Ledgity’s SPV. In return, the Ledgity protocol issues LUSDC at a 1:1 ratio in the form of ERC-20 tokens, where each LUSDC represents one dollar in the SPV. Transferring the LUSDC token effectively transfers ownership of the underlying claim of USDC. While investors aren’t required to complete KYC, they are subject to on-chain AML monitoring and analysis to ensure compliance.

LUSDC is a rebase token meaning that the investors see the number of LUSDC tokens growing overtime at the rate equal to the yield generated by the portfolio net of fees.

Investors can withdraw up to 5% of the Assets Under Management (AUM) instantly. For withdrawals exceeding 5% within a 24-hour period, processing may take 2-3 business days.

Service Providers Overview

Delubac Asset Management has a mandate to manage the portfolio of T-Bills. U.S. Treasury Bills are held in custody in a segregated custodial account at Bank Delubac & Cie. BPCE (Natixis Group) is the sub-custodian of this account.

*In option, we can create a dedicated fund with an agreement of the AMF and a specific objective (US Money Market Fund). The custody is held by CACEIS, a daily NAV is published by CACEIS + AMF agreement, custody and valuation independent from the asset manager, CACEIS is rated A1/A+.

Issuer Ledgity: Ledgity interface helps investors to track and manage their investments. Ledgity.finance has a section called “Invest” where investors can:

  1. Deposit and withdraw
  2. View the amount invested and the yield received
  3. View the current APR

In the documentation you can find more information about how Ledgity protocol works: https://docs.ledgity.finance/

Investors can withdraw up to 5% of the Assets Under Management (AUM) instantly. For withdrawals exceeding 5% within a 24-hour period, processing may take 2-3 business days.

Circle facilitates the conversion of USD to USDC and vice versa.

Gnosis Safe ensures an m/n approval process to initiate and sign digital transactions to move USDC from the Safe Fund Wallet to Ledgity Circle Account and vice versa.

2. Describe the underlying asset:

See below for a table of the construction of the portfolio sorted by Maturity Date. The current weighted average duration is ~29 days.

Portfolio Example :

Portfolio Characteristics :

Portfolio holdings are subject to change, according to the mandate.

3. How is yield transferred to the tokenholder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

LUSDC is a rebase token. Therefore, the yield is automatically distributed to the investors in the form of new LUSDC. Each LUSDC token has a value of $1 and represents one dollar of the U.S Treasury Bills’ portfolio.

LUSDC token has 6 decimal places, with 1.000000 (1e6 on Ethereum) representing one dollar. Investors redeeming 1 LUSDC receive 1 USDC. LUSDC functions similarly to Lido’s stETH.

You can read more about the yield distribution, here.

4. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

Investment Manager: Delubac Asset Management: France

Ledgity protocol: France

Custodian: Bank Delubac & Cie, France (BPCE/Natixis sub-custodian)

5. What are the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?

Ledgity Protocol invests, via Delubac AM, at least 95% of its net assets in U.S. Treasury Bills with a maturity max less than 6 months. No more than 10% allocation by T-bills. Assets not invested in the U.S. Treasury Bills are held in the form of USDC instantly available for withdrawal from investors.

6. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?

No.

7. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

Bank Delubac & Cie - Custodian

All underlying securities (U.S. Treasury Bills) in the SPV are held in a segregated custodial account in the name of Ledgity’s SPV at Bank Delubac & Cie. This means LUSDC’s backing assets are securely held at Bank Delubac & Cie and if there is an unlikely credit or stress event, LUSDC’s backed assets will remain protected and available for withdrawal.

Delubac Asset Management is the asset management firm of the Bank Delubac & Cie founded in 1924. Delubac AM offers a suite of investment funds from monetary to equity and corporate bonds. Learn more about Delubac & Cie here.

**BPCE Group and Bank Delubac & Cie will publish on a daily basis the valorisation of the portfolio. Bank Delubac & Cie is regulated in France. It has provided comprehensive business banking services since 1924. Delubac AM has an AMF agreement in France.

Ledgity is the issuer of LUSDC, responsible for managing the Ledgity.finance platform, which includes the minting and burning of LUSDC, as well as handling the on/off-ramp services regarding depositing USDC and withdrawing LUSDC.

Circle: USDC Services
Ledgity has contracted with Circle to perform USDC mint/burn services as a convenience to investors. Circle will convert USDC to US Dollars (“USD”), and vice versa, for deposit and withdrawals into and out of the SPV.

Gnosis Safe Wallet
To manage the flow of USDC deposited in Ledgity Protocol, Ledgity requires a m of n approval process through a Gnosis Safe Multisig Wallet.

8. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain

Delubac AM manages 300M EUR. We aim to create a dedicated product answering to the specific needs of Spark and Sky Ecosystem.

9. What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?

  1. Fee: *0.10% (based upon $50M AUM). This fees includes :
  • Management fees
  • Administrative and custodian fees
  • Subscription and minting fees
  • SPV fees
  • Withdrawal fees
  • Transaction fees

*fees are degressive according to the amount of AUM.

  1. Other Fees include any expenses not expressly the responsibility of the Investment Manager:

Investors are responsible for paying gas fees onchain during the deposit and withdrawal.

10. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets?

No

11. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users)

Investors can invest in LUSDC directly from ledgity.finance without KYC.

LUSDC is freely transferable. DeFi integrations such as lending / borrowing protocol are planned to facilitate additional potential benefits.

12. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?

Not applicable. This product is dedicated to the Spark Tokenization Grand Prix.

13. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions?

  • Subscriptions:
    LUSDC offers 7/24 subscriptions. Investors can deposit USDC directly on Ledgity.finance. Funds are invested in T-Bills every business day.

  • Redemptions
    Investors can redeem LUSDC to USDC instantly 7/24 up to 5% of the AUM on Ledgity.finance. Above 5% the redemption will take 2-3 business days.

14. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

Subscription
To initiate a purchase of LUSDC, Spark will deposit USDC into Ledgity Vault on ledgity.finance, which is the smart contract of the LUSDC.

Upon deposit of USDC, Spark receives LUSDC 1:1 which is a rebase token. As soon as the USDC is deposited, Ledgity transfers the funds to its Circle account to convert USDC in USD and sends it to the SPV account at the banking Custodian, Delubac & Cie. Once the cash has settled, the capital is immediately invested by Delubac AM according to the mandate.

Redemption
Redemptions can be initiated on Ledgity.finance with the withdraw button. Up to 5% of the AUM can be withdrawn instantly in USDC. If the withdrawal represents more than 5% of the AUM, it will take 2-3 business days. Ledgity sends an order to sell US T-Bills in cash to Delubac AM. Then the capital is transferred to Circle. Circle mints the corresponding amount of USDC and Ledgity sends the USDC to the smart contract to let investors withdraw their USDC.

Gas fees are paid by Spark.

15. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work.

Ledgity recognizes the importance of immediate liquidity needs. That’s the reason why with Ledgity Protocol up to 5% of the AUM can be withdrawn instantly for USDC.
In addition, we are exploring additional layers of liquidity with several DeFi protocols such as DEX and lending/borrowing protocols.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)

Currently, subscriptions and redemptions may be made with USDC.

17. What are your future development plans for the product?

Ledgity is committed to bridging the gap between decentralized finance (DeFi) and traditional finance (TradFi). We combine DeFi and TradFi expertise with a focus on efficiency, compliance and investor protection.

To enhance liquidity and market accessibility, we’re looking to integrate our products with DeFi protocols to offer additional layers of liquidity and market efficiencies. Moreover, our R&D development team, with the collaboration of others RWA projects, is exploring to launch a new RWA Vault with a diversified portfolio of onchain RWA (actively managed by Ledgity Council) in order to create a highly efficient yield bearing stable asset providing 7%-8% APY, instant liquidity, low risk profile, transparency onchain and fully compatible with DeFi protocols.

We’re leading financial innovation onchain with cutting edge technology and benefits, seeking to establish a new asset management industry standard.

## IV. LEGAL STRUCTURE

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates

Ledgity is the issuer of the LUSDC product. Delubac Asset Management is the asset management company in charge of the management of the assets. And bank Delubac & Cie is the custodian.

LUSDC represents a loan of USDC to Ledgity’ SPV. This loan is segregated in a SPV, bankruptcy remoteness structure. Therefore, Ledgity delegates a private mandate to Delubac Asset Management in order to manage the portfolio according to the mandate.

Our setup allows seamless use of Ledgity protocol with no KYC, instant withdrawal and no minimum of investment. The funds are in custody in France at the bank Delubac & Cie.

Ledgity is regulated as Digital Asset Service Provider by the French Financial Market Authority (AMF) under the number E2022-040.

Delubac Asset Management is a management company authorized and regulated in France by the Financial Markets Authority, under approval number GP 00009, dated March 31, 2000.

2. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

Ledgity, Delubac Asset Management and bank Delubac & Cie are subject to inspection and examination by the AMF, the French Financial Market Authority and the ACPR.

3. What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, and exemptions does your product or company hold?

Ledgity is regulated as Digital Asset Service Provider French Financial Market Authority (AMF) under the number E2022-040.

Delubac Asset Management is a management company authorized and regulated in France by the Financial Markets Authority, under approval number GP 00009, dated March 31, 2000.

4. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness.

The funds are held by a dedicated SPV, segregated from the balanced sheet of the issuer, Ledgity. This structure ensures that even in case of bankruptcy of Ledgity, the funds are safe and can be withdrawn by investors. The SPV will be created for Spark and Sky Ecosystem and a legal opinion will be shared in case of selection

5. What rights do token holders have?

Investors in LUSDC are the only “creditor” of the SPV that holds the funds. They can ask at any time to withdraw their capital in USDC without penalties.

6. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?

No.

7. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or Sky

We do not see any conflicts of interest between Ledgity, Delubac AM, their employees and Sky.

8. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product

On Market Days, Delubac Asset Management provides to Ledgity the NAV (net of fees) of the portfolio by API.

Any gain realized between the withdrawal proceeds and the original deposit amount is subject to taxation at the investor’s applicable tax rate.

V. PERFORMANCE, REPORTING, AND TECHNICAL

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark

Not applicable. The proposal is dedicated to Spark Tokenization Grand Prix RFP. Performance will be closely linked to the performance of US T-Bill money market.

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these?

Ledgity is part of Chainlink BUILD Program. We are working closely with Chainlink in order to add a proof of reserve onchain oracles. This information will come directly from the Bank Delubac & Cie, the custodian.

This information can be used by Sky and Spark for transparency purposes in order to ensure that USDS holders can see the collateral backing the stablecoin via LUSDC.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product

The NAV of the portfolio is performed by BPCE Group and Delubac AM on a daily basis. The portfolio will be invested in US T Bills that are liquid, their prices are available on a daily basis on Bloomberg BGN.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product

Ledgity uses blockchains to deliver a secure and seamless investment experience. Our infrastructure ensures scalability, security, and compliance. Here’s a summary of the implementation:

a) Onchain Overview:

LUSDC Token Proxy - 0xd54d564606611A3502FE8909bBD3075dbeb77813

Global Owner: 0xe4Af4573bFc5F04D8b84c61744de8A94059f2462

Global Pause: 0xd4D4c68CE70fa88B9E527DD3A4a6d19c5cbdd4dB

Global Blacklist: 0xcA55A2394876e7Cf52e99Ab36Fc9151a7d9CF350

Our smart contracts are designed to be flexible, allowing for upgrades as needed. Key functions, like managing the Global Blacklist, are securely controlled by the Ledgity Admin Address to ensure proper oversight and compliance.

Our contracts are currently deployed on Arbitrum. They can be deployed in a day on Ethereum.

b) LUSDC: A standard Upgradable OpenZeppelin ERC-20 implementation with several modifications:

  • The LToken contract verifies that all holders are not on the global blacklist.
  • Burn - Investors can initiate a withdrawal by requesting an “instantWithdrawal” or “requestWithdrawal”.
  • Mint - New LUSDC tokens are created during deposits and as rewards for holders.
  • Implements an auto-compounding reward system for token holders.
  • The contract implements a fee system for withdrawals, with adjustable rates and tier-based exemptions. For Spark Tokenization Grand Prix withdrawal fees will be set at 0%
  • A withdrawal queue system is implemented to manage liquidity and handle large withdrawals.
  • The contract maintains a retention rate to limit asset exposure on-chain.
  • Includes a “repatriate” function for fund management between the contract and a fund wallet.

c) Transfers:

LUSDC tokens can be freely transferred between Arbitrum or Ethereum addresses using transfer or transferFrom functions. Each transaction is verified to ensure that neither the sender nor the receiver is on the global blacklist. The contract also implements a system of transfer listeners, allowing other contracts to be notified of LUSDC transfers.

**d) Black list:

For compliance and regulatory purposes, we apply AML enforcement through a global blacklist function to ensure that illicit transactions cannot impact the rest of the investors. Addresses on the blacklist cannot make deposits, withdrawals, or transfers of LUSDC tokens. Withdrawal requests from addresses that become blacklisted are frozen and can be managed separately.**

e) Additional Features:

  • Global pause functionality for emergency situations.
  • Detailed event logging for deposits, withdrawals, and other activities.
  • Separate management of “big” withdrawal requests exceeding half of the retention rate.

f) Security Measures:

  • Use of OpenZeppelin’s safe transfer functions for ERC20 tokens.
  • Implementation of reentrancy guards for critical functions.
  • Upgradeable contract structure with proper initialization checks.
  • Clearly defined access control for administrative functions

g) Additional Services:

Investor Portal: ledgity.finance allows Investors to manage and track their portfolio with ease, offering real-time access to account information.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

Ledgity has performed a smart contract audit for LUSDC via Hacken. The full audit is accessible here.

Smart Contract Auditor: Hacken

Date: March 19th, 2024

Link: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/hacken_web3-activity

## VI. SKY ECOSYSTEM

1. Describe any previous relationship with Sky and familiarity working with DAOs

This application is our first contribution to the Sky ecosystem.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the Spark Star and Sky ecosystem?

LUSDC offers crypto native investors an easy access to TradFi institutional asset managers. Pierre-Yves Dittlot, the CEO and Founder of Ledgity, has 18 years of experience in the asset management and private banking industry, managing up to $800M. For several years, he worked with financial institutions to promote the innovation brought by blockchain technology. By onboarding LUSDC, the Sky ecosystem may easily access other products offered by Ledgity in the future and co-create tailor made products for the Sky ecosystem. Ledgity promises clear transparency. Accelerated by Chainlink, Ledgity will create a Proof of Reserve oracles on-chain.

Ledgity aims to create a Council with external key leaders from the TradFi and DeFi industry. The Council will be in charge of making proposals for the creation of new products as well as contributing to the asset allocation of a future yield bearing stable asset backed by an onchain reserve of RWA, actively managed. The Sky ecosystem will be able to participate as a leader, helping us to shape the future of finance.

Finally, Ledgity launched his governance and utility token, the LDY token. We are happy to dedicate 10% of LDY supply to the Sky ecosystem as additional incentives.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

Not yet. As soon as we reach the first $20M of AUM, we will work on integrations with key DeFi protocols such as Morpho, Euler, Uniswap, Curve and more.

Our vision is to make our products widely accessible across different ecosystems and protocols to benefit onchain investors.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other Stars?

Ledgity is working to launch a permissionless yield bearing stable asset backed by an onchain RWA reserve, actively managed by Ledgity Council. As mentioned above, Ledgity Council will be composed of key leaders from the TradFi and the DeFi industry. The purpose of this product is to provide key benefits for crypto native investors: permissionless, high yield, low risk, instant liquidity, instant yield distribution, resilient, fully transparent with onchain reserve and Chainlink Proof of Reserve, backed by RWA, decentralized management by the Council.

We will be happy to collaborate with the Sky ecosystem to understand what other strategies/exposures might be suitable and to launch new product on demand.

item.title: Questions about Negative MKR Balances and Their Impact on Governance Polls
item.dc:creator: ohho
item.description:
Dear MakerDAO community,

While reviewing governance poll results, I’ve noticed some concerning patterns that I’d like to bring to the community’s attention and seek clarification on.

I’ve observed multiple instances where wallets with “0 MKR” or “≈0 MKR” voting power have participated in governance polls.

Upon closer inspection, I’ve discovered something even more alarming - wallets with negative MKR balances appear to be voting and impacting poll results.

Let me provide a specific example:

In Poll 232 (Maker Governance - MIP9 Community Greenlight Poll - renBTC - July 20, 2020), there were 30 wallets that voted with a Total Voting Power of 21,315.378 MKR. One wallet (0x1EBb814C9EF016E6012bE299ED834f1dDcEd1529) shows “≈0 MKR” voting power.

However, when summing the MKR from the other 29 wallets, the total is 21,439.68 MKR - which is 123.764 MKR more than the reported Total Voting Power. (Is the voting power of 29 wallets greater than 30 wallets?)

Checking this wallet’s historical balance on Etherscan (https://etherscan.io/token/0x9f8f72aa9304c8b593d555f12ef6589cc3a579a2?a=0x1EBb814C9EF016E6012bE299ED834f1dDcEd1529#tokenAnalytics), I found that it has maintained a negative MKR balance for an extended period. At the time of voting on Poll 232, its balance was precisely -123.764 MKR.

This wallet has participated in multiple governance polls despite its negative balance (Maker Governance - Governance Portal).

This raises several concerning questions:

  1. Is it possible for wallets to have negative MKR balances? If so, why does this occur?

  2. Why are wallets with negative MKR balances allowed to participate in governance polls?

  3. If voting with negative MKR is permitted, how is the voting weight calculated? For instance, if a wallet with -200 MKR votes “Yes” on a poll, does this increase the voter count by 1 but decrease the total MKR count by 200?

This situation seems to pose a potential threat to MakerDAO’s governance, especially during this transitional period. If a malicious actor were to exploit this using wallets with large negative MKR balances, it could significantly impact voting outcomes.

I would greatly appreciate if someone from the community or the core team could address these concerns and provide clarity on how negative MKR balances are handled in the governance system.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
