item.description:
M^0 Grand Prix Application ($M)

I. Product Summary

 
1. Project name

M^0

2. Product name

$M

3. Product type / underlying asset

$M is a permissionless, immutable cryptodollar (currently) exclusively backed by short term t-bills (0-90 day maturity). The M^0 protocol is capable of passing protocol yield to governance-approved parties, as a function of the underlying collateral yield and governance parameter, currently at a rate of 5% APY. While this rate should roughly track the yield on the collateral portfolio, the M^0 protocol allows governance to express monetary policy in ways similar to Maker, while protecting the $M’s overcollateralization.

4. Issuer jurisdiction

Like USDS and DAI, the same $M can be issued by several parties and should thus be considered a multi-issuer cryptodollar. Actors called “Minters” are able to deposit collateral into specially purposed structures (SPVs) that are designed exclusively to serve the protocol, and for which Minters must provide evidence to governance. Minters can then bring this balance on-chain with the assistance of one or more “Validators.” One of our first Validators is Chronicle Labs, the team that has been powering Maker’s (and now Sky’s) oracles since the project’s inception. Once the collateral balance is on-chain, the Minter can generate up to a certain percentage of its value in $M. Minters accrue interest on the collateral balance, and pay a fee to the protocol (the Minter Rate). The vast majority of those proceeds are passed by the protocol to eligible Earners.

The first Minter (issuer) in the M^0 ecosystem is MXON, an entity operating in the British Virgin Islands.

5. Product website

m0.org

M^0 | Money Middleware For The Digital Age

Based on a decentralized architecture and best-in-class collateral design, M^0 allows institutions to issue a cryptodollar.

6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact

Gregory Di Prisco, Chief Architect, Email: greg-sparkrfp@m0.org

II. Company Details

1. Company description

M^0 is not a traditional company, but a decentralized protocol like Sky. The protocol was built by M^0 Labs (The Thing GmbH), which is based in Berlin, Germany. Since the protocol is immutable, M^0 Labs, the M^0 Foundation (Switzerland), and any other affiliated entity, no longer has the ability to upgrade or control the protocol. Token holders, which include founders, team members, and investors (see www.m0.org for our list of investors) control a limited set of parameters in the protocol through the governance process. In M^0 governance, all token holders are required to participate or else lose 10% of their voting power per missed vote, providing a high likelihood that proposals are exposed and voted on by the entire set of governors. The primary function of governance in M^0 is to approve Minters, Validators, Earners, and updates to the Adopted Guidance. (Please reference the whitepaper for more detailed information).

2. Key personnel biographies

Leadership Team - M^0 Labs/M^0 Foundation

Greg Di Prisco is a Co-Founder and the Chief Architect at M^0 Labs and a Council Member at the M^0 Foundation. M^0 is a federation of issuers operating on the decentralized M^0 Protocol where they mint the fungible cryptodollar, $M. Greg has had an extensive career in the crypto industry, with a speciality in DeFi. Prior to co-founding M^0, Greg was a Co-Founder and Protocol Architect at Ajna Labs, creators of the Ajna Protocol. He also spent over four years as the Head of Business Development of the Maker Foundation, the builders of MakerDAO. Additionally, Greg is a Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Distributed Capital Partners, one of the earliest crypto-exclusive venture firms, founded in 2017. Prior to working in the crypto industry, Greg was a commodity futures trader at Axiom Markets. He holds a BS in Economics from Villanova University.

Luca Prosperi is Co-Founder and CEO at M^0 Labs, and President at the M^0 Foundation. With a 20-year career dedicated to building, advising, researching, and investing in financial intermediaries, Luca Prosperi has been at the forefront of transformative change in the financial sector. His journey has seen him contribute to the evolution of some of the most impactful DeFi protocols, including his previous role in Lending Oversight at MakerDAO, and advising investors operating in this space.

Oliver Schimek is Co-Founder and COO at M^0 Labs, and Council Member at the M^0 Foundation. Oliver has extensive experience in the field of securitization of various assets. He was the CEO and founder of the digital securitization platform CrossLend, a position he held since 2014. Prior to that, he was the CFO and CIO of Kreditech Holding SSL GmbH from 2013 to 2014. Before that, he served as the CEO of Quantea from 2010 to 2013, where he developed quantitative trading models for FX markets. Oliver, while being a physicist by background, has led regulated and unregulated businesses in financial services.

Joao Reginatto is Chief Product Officer at M^0 Labs and has a wealth of experience in the stablecoin sector. Before joining M^0, Joao spent 8 years at Circle where he was VP Product for Stablecoins and led the development and launch of USDC and EURC, as well as multiple stablecoin infrastructure products. Joao has over 20 years experience in tech product development.

Jacob Laufer is Chief Growth Officer at M^0 Labs, where he leads efforts to expand the M^0 network and $M ecosystem. Jacob has extensive experience in stablecoins and DeFi, having served as a leadership council member for a large DeFi protocol while leading its treasury, partnership and core product teams. Jacob began his career at Solomon Partners, where he spent nine years as a restructuring and M&A investment banker.

Antonina Norair is the co-CTO of M^0 Labs, where she is leading the Protocol Web3 team’s initiatives to develop the next generation of on-chain cryptodollars. Prior to this role, she held senior engineering positions at ConsenSys, Compound Labs, and Moonpay.

Stefan Kleff is the co-CTO of M^0 Labs, where he also helps spearhead the Protocol Web3 team’s initiatives to develop the next generation of on-chain cryptodollars. Prior to joining M^0, Stefan was the CTO at CrossLend, a Berlin-based Fintech company offering a digital platform for end-to-end loan portfolio transactions.

Andrew Khang is the Deputy COO of the M^0 Foundation, where he leads special projects and supervises the evolution of the entity in its purpose of developing the M^0 ecosystem. Andrew first joined M^0 Labs as Chief of Staff in 2023 and has extensive experience operating companies across different industries, including HubSpot and GE.

Leadership Team - Crosslend

Marco Hinz is the Managing Director at CrossLend, where he leverages his extensive operational experience to drive the company’s strategic growth. Prior to his role, Marco served as Chief Operating Officer at CrossLend for over six years, overseeing key operational developments.

Leadership Team - MXON

Jacqueline To is the Head of Operations and is responsible for the operational build-out and smooth running of the first Minter on the M^0 network, MXON. Jac has over a decade of experience in traditional finance and crypto trading. She held positions in the Global Markets businesses at Barclays and JP Morgan, specializing in fixed income. After spending time at Circle, she joined HashKey to build out its trading and brokerage franchise, as well as token products.

Hubert Newell is the Senior Operations Manager at MXON. Hubert has 10 years experience working in the crypto space, working with successful projects like Circle, Blockfolio, Swan Bitcoin and Brave Browser. He has held lead positions in product management with many Web3 firms and led teams across the whole spectrum of operations. Hubert also founded Sharpdraw Consultancy, which helps startups in the Web3 space and advises funds wanting to invest in the space.

3. Team size

39 people across all affiliated entities

4. Years in operation

Protocol launch date: May 7th, 2024

Company founding: October 19th, 2022

III. Product Information

1. Describe the product

M^0 is a decentralized protocol, as well as a set of off-chain standards and APIs, that allows institutional holders of high-quality collateral to issue fungible cryptodollars (“stablecoins”). As in the Sky protocol, everything in the M^0 protocol must be achieved through decentralized governance. We designed a custom governance mechanism which over time enforces 100% participation from all token holders and requires total transparency for even the slightest alteration – nothing is outsourced to centralized parties. Our protocol’s smart contracts are completely immutable and cannot be upgraded through governance. Our protocol was audited 8 times by some of the best names in the business, including Prototech, who wrote many of the smart contracts that Maker has been using for years. We are confident that M^0 is the only safe and credibly neutral solution to Sky’s needs.

2. Describe the underlying asset

$M is a permissionless, immutable cryptodollar that combines the benefits of digital dollars with the risk profile of physical cash. Backed by Eligible Collateral, currently short-term U.S. Treasury bills held in insolvency-remote, orphaned SPVs, $M is issued through a permissionless and immutable protocol, ensuring daily auditable reserves. M^0’s overcollateralized model not only secures the value of $M but also allows institutional partners to earn yield natively, without additional smart contract risk. $M is currently paying 5% to these Earners, making it an attractive option for on-chain treasuries seeking secure and transparent returns .

3. How is yield transferred to the tokenholder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

There are two options for yield accrual - rebasing, which is the native way to accrue yield on $M, or claiming via our wrapper contract, Smart $M. Rebasing occurs continuously while claiming via the wrapper is triggered manually or upon transfers.

4. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

The first issuer in the M^0 ecosystem is MXON. The company is based out of the British Virgin Islands. The key entities are “Minter One Ltd.” and “Minter One Generator (SPV) Ltd” Currently, the shareholders of M^0 Labs and MXON are very similar as MXON was created to help bootstrap the network. Furthermore, the collateral is held in a Luxembourg, orphaned, bankruptcy-remote SPV incorporated as “Asset Repository Sàrl”.

5. What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?

At this current time, according to the governance-approved Adopted Guidance, only short term (<90 day residual maturity) US t-bills are considered Eligible Collateral. No bank deposits whatsoever are counted towards Minter collateralization. Eligible Collateral is tested on a near-daily basis to ensure continued eligibility.

6. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?

No

7. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

SPV (Asset Repository Sàrl)

SPV Operator - Crosslend GmbH

Corporate Service Provider - MaplesFS Luxembourg

Custodian Bank - DekaBank

Corporate Bank - DekaBank

Broker - DekaBank

Digital Asset Trading/Custody - Coinbase

Auditor - PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC)

Taxes - Tax Connected Sàrl

Exchanges - Coinbase

Trading Partners - Coinbase, Galaxy (pending), Circle (pending)

BD Minter (Minter One Ltd., d.b.a. MXON)

Key Management - Fireblocks

KYC Service Provider - MaplesFS Luxembourg

Trading Partners - Galaxy, GSR, Wintermute

Minter (Minter One Generator (SPV) Ltd.)

Key Management - Fireblocks

Capital Providers - The Next Thing Ltd.

Validators - (Validator One GmbH, Chronicle Labs)

8. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain

Ethereum Mainnet - 42,734,580 $M

Eligible Collateral (off-chain) - $ 54,000,000

This initial TVL/AUM is the result of a few months of efforts. We anticipate significant increases, based on existing agreements, across several blockchain ecosystems in the coming months.

9. What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?

Minters in the M^0 network will compete on purchase/sale fee structure. The current fee for purchasing or selling through MXON is $0. Once on-chain, $M is tradable in a 1 bps UniV3 market with PSM-style (i.e. 1-tick) liquidity. Our liquidity partners will periodically rebalance this pool by purchasing or selling directly with MXON (and potentially other Minters), to ensure Sky and other users have sufficient on-chain liquidity for their needs.

10. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets?

M^0 is structured similarly to MakerDAO v1 – a user (Minter) comes to the protocol with collateral (US t-bills) that they anticipate will increase in value. They generate a credit line against this collateral ($M) and pay interest (the Minter Rate) on that credit line. The Minter keeps (or loses) the spread between what they are earning in collateral appreciation and the Minter Rate.

Currently, the Minter Rate is slotted to be set to 4.8% and the collateral has an average yield of 5.10%, leaving a levered (by the Mint Ratio which is currently 95%, and in the process of changing to 97%) 30 bps spread for the Minter to cover its own expenses. This level of spread ceases to be loss generating and is sustainable at approximately $300M+ in AUM. We anticipate for the fixed and variable costs of operating a Minter/SPV combination to compress substantially over the coming years and therefore for breakeven Minter AUM to compress significantly as well.

11. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users)

$M as a native asset is entirely permissionless and immutable. In order to become a Minter, Validator, or Earner, the entity must submit an application and be approved by the on-chain governance process. All off-chain entities must be approved by the rules in the Adopted Guidance, which requires governance approval to amend.

12. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?

N/A - On-chain liquidity for $M was only launched this week. We anticipate this volume to grow significantly.

There is a Uniswap v3 Pool being managed by our liquidity partners which should soon hold approximately $20M of liquidity in $M and $USDC. We plan to support the growth of this and other liquidity facilities.

13. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions?

We estimate that current Minters will require a maximum of 5 days to purchase/sell $M, mainly due to bank holidays abutting a weekend. In the normal course of business, purchasing or selling $M should not take longer than 3 business days, as the t-bill collateral must be sold and the transaction and wire transfers cleared. We have not had any interruptions to date. As mentioned above, we anticipate that Sky will never need to integrate directly with Minters and will be able to exclusively use on-chain liquidity facilities to enter/exit $M.

14. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

For $M holders who do not wish to utilize secondary markets or OTC desks, direct purchase or sale requests can be made with Minters, assuming they are qualified entities and not based in a restricted jurisdiction such as the USA. The transaction requires KYC/AML checks with the BD Minter and potentially with the Corporate Service Provider. This process may take up to a week once all documentation has been received. Again, it is not anticipated that Sky, being a crypto-native organization, will need to interface with real-world entities and should be able to exercise its needs via on-chain liquidity facilities.

15. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work.

In addition to primary market liquidity, $M is currently tradable in a 1 bps UniV3 market with PSM-style (i.e. 1-tick) liquidity. Our liquidity partners will periodically rebalance this pool by purchasing or selling directly with MXON (and potentially other Minters), to ensure Sky and other users have sufficient on-chain liquidity for their needs.

Furthermore, the M^0 Foundation is working closely with institutional partners to bring substantial (~$100 million) additional secondary market liquidity for the long-term.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)

USDC; fiat; DAI; USDS

17. What are your future development plans for the product?

M^0 and its affiliated entities have raised nearly $60M of pure equity over the past two years, from an unparalleled group of some of the most reputable and long-term oriented crypto and fintech investors, with a commitment to continuously improving our infrastructure and offering new services to the ecosystem. Recently, we have deployed Smart $M, and have near-term plans to expand $M to several other ecosystems.

We are also actively sourcing new Minters, Validators and Earners to further expand and strengthen the ecosystem, with several protocols and institutions currently being onboarded following approval by governance. Adding new Minters is directly beneficial to Sky, as they can compete for Sky’s business by offering the best rates, and further enhance protocol decentralization.

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates

Much like Sky, M^0 is a decentralized protocol that manages legal structuring off-chain. The requirements for legal structures of approved actors are outlined in detail in our Adopted Guidance.

2. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

Each Minter is overseen in their respective jurisdiction(s). The first issuer, MXON, is incorporated in the British Virgin Islands and therefore falls under this jurisdiction.

3. What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold?

N/A

4. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness

All collateral which backs $M must be demonstrably, continuously held in orphaned, insolvency remote, special purpose vehicles (SPVs). Specifically, all SPVs in the M^0 ecosystem must meet the following criteria, which is taken from our most recent governance-approved Adopted Guidance:

  • is an orphaned entity;
  • is minimally affiliated (via its shareholders) with or (practically) controlled by any Validator or Minter or the affiliates of any Validator or Minter;
  • does not conduct any other business except the storage of collateral for Minters and issuance of Notes to Minters;
  • is a restricted-purpose vehicle that prevents entering into any other liabilities but the ones directly related to the storage of collateral and the issuance of Notes against such collateral;
  • is designed to be insolvency remote;
  • is incorporated in an Approved Jurisdiction, as described below;
  • possesses all required licenses and permissions (if necessary) to store collateral and to issue Notes against such collateral;
  • is audited on an annual basis by a licensed auditor deemed appropriate to perform the task.

Additionally, any Notes issued to the Minter shall comply with the following in order to be considered Eligible Collateral:

  • Full asset segregation of collateral not only at the Minter level, but also at the level of each wallet address controlled by the Minter — in case the Minter controls more than one permissioned address.
  • Limited recourse so that the claims of any Minter are strictly limited to the collateral belonging to its Notes.

Currently the only Approved Jurisdiction is Luxembourg, but this list is expected to grow to other high quality jurisdictions as the list of approved Minters grows. Candidates for Approved Jurisdictions shall comply with the following minimum requirements (again taken from the Adopted Guidance):

  • Bankruptcy Remoteness - The jurisdiction provides legal and structural mechanisms that reduce the risk of insolvency for the legal entity, reinforcing the effectiveness of provisions that prevent creditors and investors from initiating insolvency proceedings against the legal entity or seizing its assets or the assets of its compartments, estates or sub-funds.
  • Non-Petition and Non-Seizure Provisions - Jurisdictions must uphold provisions that prevent creditors and investors from initiating insolvency proceedings against a legal entity or seizing its assets or the assets of its compartments or estates or sub-funds, thus ensuring the legal entity’s bankruptcy remoteness.
  • Priority of Payments and Subordination - The legal system recognises and enforces contractual or statutory arrangements that clearly define the priority of payments and the subordination of claims among investors and creditors.
  • Regulatory Compliance - The jurisdiction has a regulatory framework that supports the business activities of the legal entity, including clear guidelines for the trading of financial instruments and Eligible Collateral associated with them.
  • Legal and Regulatory Framework - The jurisdiction has a legal and regulatory framework that permits the issuance of financial instruments and the investment in Eligible Collateral.
  • Political Stability - The jurisdiction exhibits a high degree of political stability, characterized by a consistent and predictable legal and regulatory environment, minimal political unrest, and an upholding of the rule of law.
  • Dispute Resolution - An effective legal framework for dispute resolution is in place, including access to courts or arbitration panels.
  • Asset Segregation - Collateral for each Minter is either to be stored in a separate legal entity per Minter or the jurisdiction must provide legal frameworks that enable the establishment of separate compartments or estates or sub-funds within a single legal entity, ensuring that each compartment or estate or sub-fund is its own distinct pool of assets and liabilities. There must be clear legal recognition that assets within one compartment or estate or sub-fund are exclusively reserved for the investors and creditors of that compartment or estate or sub-fund and are protected from the claims of creditors of other compartments or estates or sub-funds and claims of creditors of the legal entity to ensure the functioning of the intended wind down processes, as described below.
  • Limited Recourse- The legal system must enforce that the claims of investors and creditors are strictly limited to the assets of the compartment or estate or sub-fund to which they have exposure. In cases where the assets of a compartment or estate or sub-fund are insufficient to satisfy the claims, the legal framework permits the extinguishment of any remaining claims, prohibiting further recovery efforts.
  • Investor Protection - There are robust mechanisms in place to protect investors, including clear disclosure requirements and the enforcement of fiduciary duties by the managers of the legal entity.
  • Operational Infrastructure - The jurisdiction boasts a developed financial infrastructure capable of supporting complex financial transactions, including experienced service providers and legal counsel with expertise in financial matters.
  • Custody Relationship - The jurisdiction recognises and enforces the legal nature of the custody relationship between the legal entity and its custodian, ensuring that assets held in custody are protected and segregated from the custodian’s general estate in the event of its bankruptcy.
  • Audit - The jurisdiction requires the mandatory (by law) audit of the annual financial statements of the legal entity

5. What rights do tokenholders have?

Governance token holders may add/remove Minters, Validators, and Earners, and may set a short list of protocol parameters, including the Earner Rate.

6. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?

No

7. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO

$M is a decentralized cryptodollar and in certain use cases may be considered competitive to DAI/USDS.

M^0’s investors and institutional token holders include some of the most sophisticated players in the crypto and fintech investing scene. While most of those parties do not disclose their positions in liquid markets, we believe it to be plausible that some of those investors are currently also token holders within the Maker ecosystem.

The M^0 Foundation has hired Steakhouse Financial in a number of capacities to assist with M^0’s ecosystem growth.

8. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product

As $M and its yield distribution is entirely on-chain, the holder of the token must determine its own tax liability.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark


Blue Line: The average of the Federal Funds rate and the 3-month t-bill rate
Red Line: The M^0 Protocol Earner Rate since protocol inception

In order to benchmark $M against the performance of its collateral basket, we have taken the average of the Federal Funds Rate and the 3-month t-bill rate and charted this combined rate since the inception of the protocol (May 7th, 2024). The M^0 Earner rate has been consistently 5% from this point, reflecting a healthy but competitive spread below the income of the collateral basket. In this context, $M has performed (for Earners) as expected and should continue to do so as governance monitors the performance of the underlying collateral basket.

From a solvency perspective, $M remains significantly overcollateralized by its Eligible Collateral.

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these?

Approximately once per day (30 hours) every Minter with an active balance of Owed $M must submit a proof of reserve. Failure to post this proof on-chain results in a Penalty Rate being charged on their balance of Owed $M. They achieve this by calling the updateCollateral() method in the M^0 smart contracts and providing the current USD value of the Eligible Collateral in their associated SPV. However, they cannot submit this transaction on-chain without a governance-provided quorum of Validator signatures. Validators are written into the bank and custodial accounts of the SPV and are attesting that the USD value of the Eligible Collateral is identical to what the Minter has provided. M^0 is by far the most transparent and provides the most frequent updates compared to any peer in the industry.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product

Each day, the Minter must put the USD value of the Eligible Collateral on-chain using current market prices for the collateral. From here, they can only mint the Mint Ratio (currently 95% but proposed to become 97%) against the balance of the Eligible Collateral as $M.

The SPV holding the collateral is reviewed daily by all Validators associated with the Minter, a review for which Validators provide on-chain signature verification and will soon provide live information at the individual asset level, and undergoes an annual audit by a professional audit firm.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product

M^0 is a simple, heavily audited DeFi protocol that coordinates Minters and Validators to mint $M. It operates on a novel, rigorously audited governance mechanism known as the Two Token Governor (TTG), designed to optimize for 100% token holder participation. Our entire codebase is open source and can be found here.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

A full list of audits and reports can be found here. M^0 Labs spent over $1M for security audits of the protocol and TTG. The auditors were as follows:

  • Quantstamp
  • Three Sigma
  • Certora
  • Chainsecurity
  • OpenZeppelin
  • Prototech Labs
  • Independent - Kirill Fedoseev
  • Sherlock

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs

M^0 has two co-founders, Greg Di Prisco and Luca Prosperi, who have both worked extensively in the MakerDAO ecosystem. Greg served as the Head of Business Development for the Maker Foundation from its inception through the Foundation’s wind-down and advised counterparties in structuring RWA deals for MakerDAO. Luca led the proposed LOVE core unit (though it was not ultimately approved by governance) and played a key role in protocol governance as well as in several RWA transactions within MakerDAO.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?

M^0 and the $M cryptodollar are not just another yield-bearing stablecoin, but rather a sister protocol to Sky that was built from first principles. M^0 provides Sky the kind of permissionlessness, immutability and transparency that only a fellow decentralized organization can offer. With our multi-issuer model and focus on integrating sophisticated institutions into the ecosystem, M^0 and Sky can grow symbiotically, free from the conflicts of interest and vendor lock-in typically associated with centralized providers.

Additionally, M^0 strives to be the most transparent cryptodollar in existence. We are in the process of launching a comprehensive information dashboard that should provide $M holders with all relevant information they may require. The following are screenshots from version 1 of the dashboard.

Collateral breakdown of $M

Collateralization per Minter over time

The dashboard will be a continually improving product aimed to provide the ultimately level of transparency and real time information to $M holders.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

$M has several pending integrations:

  • Morpho Vault curated by Steakhouse Financial
  • Euler Vault curated by Re7
  • Incentivized Curve stableswap pool with USD0
  • USD0/$M Morpho vault curated by MEV Capital
  • Integration with Mezo L2 as default yield-bearing stablecoin on the network
  • Other pending integrations can be discussed in detail privately upon request

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

If $M is accepted as collateral for USDS/DAI, we would be pleased to freely license our wrapper technology, called Smart $M, to Spark and other SubDAOs. Smart $M allows for the arbitrary distribution of yield across integrations, providing a powerful tool for optimizing returns.

Moreover, M^0 is committed to continuous innovation and will consider additional technologies developed by our team for the betterment of this integration. We strongly believe that M^0’s potential to grow alongside the MakerDAO ecosystem in the long term remains unmatched.

I. Product Summary

1. Project name:

Lift Dollar (USDL)

2. Product name

Lift Dollar (USDL)

3. Product type / underlying asset

USDL is a yield-bearing ERC-20 Stablecoin.

Lift Dollar (USDL) reserve assets are held in cash and equivalents in the below categories, as required by our regulator

  • Cash deposits residing in a bank deposit account

  • US Government Securities with three-month or less residual maturity

  • Overnight reverse repurchase agreements overcollateralized by US Government Securities

  • US Government Money Market Funds

4. Issuer jurisdiction

United Arab Emirates

5. Product website

www.liftdollar.com

6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact

Bhau Kotecha, Product Lead, bkotecha@paxos.com

Ronak Daya, Head of Product, rdaya@paxos.com

II. Company Details

1. Company description

Paxos Issuance MENA Ltd (doing business as Paxos International) provides digital asset services to partners and is Regulated by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of the Abu Dhabi Global Market.

Paxos is the leading regulated blockchain infrastructure and tokenization platform. Its products are the foundation for a new, open financial system that can operate faster and more efficiently. Today, trillions of dollars are locked in inefficient, outdated financial plumbing that is inaccessible to millions of people. Paxos is replatforming the financial system to enable assets to instantaneously move anywhere in the world, at any time, in a trustworthy way.

Paxos partners with leading global enterprises to tokenize, custody, and trade assets. Its blockchain solutions are used by leaders like PayPal, Interactive Brokers, Mastercard, Mercado Libre and Nubank. It is the issuer of numerous regulated digital assets including PayPal USD (PYUSD), Pax Dollar (USDP) and Pax Gold (PAXG). Its affiliate company Paxos International issues the yield-bearing regulated stablecoin Lift Dollar (USDL). Prudentially regulated by the NYDFS in the US, the MAS in Singapore, and FSRA in Abu Dhabi Global Market, Paxos is a top-funded fintech company with more than $540 million raised from leading investors including Oak HC/FT, Declaration Partners, Founders Fund, Mithril Capital and PayPal Ventures.

2. Key personnel biographies

Please reference the separate attachment submitted via email for more information on our Senior Management. Additionally, Paxos’ corporate activities and performance are overseen by an independent Board of Directors. More information can be found on our website. Company - Paxos

3. Team size

Paxos International has less than 5 direct employees. The Paxos group has over 250+ employees that support all of Paxos subsidiaries through an inter-company agreement.

4. Years in operation

Paxos International was formed in January 2024. The parent group was formed in March 2012.

III. Product Information

1. Describe the product

Lift Dollar (USDL) is a regulated yield-bearing ERC-20 stablecoin issued by Paxos International and overseen by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) in the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM). USDL distributes the yield generated on reserve assets directly to token holders on a daily basis. This is achieved through a rebasing mechanism that increases the circulating supply by the rate of daily distributed interest without any action needed from token holders. Currently USDL is only issued on Ethereum but we plan to issue USDL on additional blockchains this year.

2. Describe the underlying asset

Lift Dollar (USDL) reserve assets are held in cash and equivalents in the below categories, as required by our regulator:

  • Cash deposits residing in a bank deposit account

  • US Government Securities with three-month or less residual maturity

  • Overnight reverse repurchase agreements overcollateralized by US Government Securities

  • US Government Money Market Funds

3. How is yield transferred to the token holder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

USDL is an ERC-20 token, with the USDL smart contract distributing yield daily through a rebasing mechanism. Rebasing was chosen as an efficient, scalable approach for distributing yield. Yield is generated from the token’s reserves that are invested in cash and cash equivalent assets. Every day around 8:30 am EST, token holders’ USDL balance increases as a result of rebasing.

4. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

Abu Dhabi Global Markets

5. What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?

USDL cannot be held by US institutions or individuals. There are no additional restrictions toward asset eligibility.

6. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?

No, the use of hedging or derivatives is not permitted by our regulator. Lift Dollar (USDL) reserve assets are held in cash and equivalents in the below categories, as required by our regulator:

  • Cash deposits residing in a bank deposit account

  • US Government Securities with three-month or less residual maturity

  • Overnight reverse repurchase agreements overcollateralized by US Government Securities

  • US Government Money Market Funds

7. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

USDL Reserves are currently held in the form of cash (at regulated financial institutions), short-term US Treasury Bills (at qualified custodians) and in a US Government Money Market Funds.

8. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain

$48.1M as of submission - all on Ethereum for now.

  • RWA.xyz | Lift Dollar

  • Etherscan link here

9. What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?

CONFIDENTIAL. Terms submitted via email for consideration.

10. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets?

CONFIDENTIAL. Terms to be submitted via email for consideration.

11. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users)

USDL is permissionless.

12. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?

$78M as of submission.

  • RWA.xyz | Lift Dollar

  • Etherscan link here

13. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions?

Pursuant to Paxos International’s customer terms and conditions, all redemptions of stablecoin must be processed within one business day. As a general matter, Paxos International makes best efforts to process stablecoin redemptions as quickly as possible. It is further noted that USDL is redeemable via multiple well regarded over-the-counter trading desks including FlowDesk and GSR. Further, there are USDL <> stablecoin pairs are a number of decentralized exchanges, including but not limited to, Curve.

Stablecoin to stablecoin flows can be automated through Paxos’ asset orchestration platform for 24/7 access for subscriptions and redemptions.

For fiat subscriptions and redemptions, Paxos’ facilitates movements on a T+1 basis on business days.

We have not had any interruptions to our ability to process redemptions and subscriptions.

14. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

Please see the following diagrams for an overview of our flow of funds.

15. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work.

USDL is redeemable via multiple well regarded over-the-counter trading desks including FlowDesk and GSR. Further, there are USDL <> stablecoin pairs are a number of decentralized exchanges, including but not limited to, Curve.

Stablecoin to stablecoin flows can be automated through Paxos’ asset orchestration platform for 24/7 access for subscriptions and redemptions valued up to $1M. Stablecoin to stablecoin subscriptions and redemptions exceeding $1M will be processed on a T+1 basis on business days.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)

Paxos International directly supports subscriptions and redemptions via fiat and USDC.

External to Paxos International, we note that there are USDL <> fiat backed stablecoin pairs on numerous decentralized exchanges. Currently the largest liquidity pool is a USDC <> USDL pool on Curve with TVL of $9M.

17. What are your future development plans for the product?

Future development plans for USDL include:

  • Wrapped USDL to enable adoption of USDL in ecosystems where rebasing tokens are not supported

  • Issuance on additional blockchains such as Arbitrum

  • Expand permissionless liquidity venues and depth across the ecosystem, expand to additional stablecoin pairs including USDT and DAI

  • Expand Paxos platform stablecoin orchestration to include 24/7 subscription and redemptions up to $5M to USDL from other stablecoins (USDC, USDT, PYUSD, USDP, DAI)

  • Interoperability with other stablecoins that are created

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates

The USDL token is centrally minted and burned by Paxos International, licensed and regulated by the FSRA to conduct the Regulated Activity of “Providing Money Services” in the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM). The FSRA has granted Paxos Issuance MENA Ltd. (doing business as Paxos International) a Financial Services Permission for the provision of Money Services (FSP) to conduct the FSRA-regulated activity of providing money services in and from the ADGM. Under FSRA rules, stablecoins are treated as a “mechanism for storing value” similar to e-money. USDL meets the FSRA criteria to be deemed an Accepted Virtual Asset following the FSRA assessment.

2. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

Paxos International is regulated by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) of the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM).

3. What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold?

Paxos International has approval from the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of the Abu Dhabi Global Market to issue U.S. dollar and other currency backed stablecoins.

4. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness

Paxos International holds all reserve assets segregated and bankruptcy protected with permitted custodians for the benefit of token holders, in accordance with COBS pursuant to the FSRA framework for Fiat-Referenced Tokens (FRTs). All reserve assets are held by Paxos International for the benefit of the token holders and cannot be used by Paxos International’s general creditors in the event of an insolvency of Paxos International or any of its affiliates.

The Paxos International reserve management approach includes the following safeguards for all assets:

  • The mint and burn operation requires the requisite amount of US dollars in the USDL reserve account before Paxos International mints USDL.

  • Paxos International employs a robust intraday liquidity management program to assess cash balances and asset custody across all banking and custodial relationships.

  • Reserve assets may be held in one or more of the following categories, as required by the FSRA:

    • Cash, residing in segregated bank deposit accounts held for the benefit of USDL holders.
    • Cash equivalents and debt securities issued by the U.S. Government or organizations that are of both a government and international character with a minimum credit rating of “AA-” with up to three (month) residual maturity.
    • Institutional stable NAV USD government money-market funds, domiciled in non-US jurisdictions with weighted average maturities (WAMs) of no greater than 60 days and weighted average lives (WALs) of no greater than 120 days, subject to FSRA-approved limits on the value of reserve assets to be held in such funds and FSRA-approved credit ratings of such funds.
    • Reverse repurchase agreements overcollateralized by debt securities issued by U.S. Government with maturities of one business day, with a counterparty that is not Paxos International affiliated and adequately creditworthy (as defined by the FSRA credit rating requirements).

Eligible reserve assets may be acquired and managed directly by the Paxos International treasury and portfolio management team or indirectly through third-party investment managers in the form of separately managed accounts (SMAs).

5. What rights do token holders have?

Pursuant to FSRA requirements, in the event of Paxos International’s insolvency or another triggering event as defined by the FSRA, the USDL reserves are required to be liquidated and distributed on a first priority basis to all USDL holders on a pro rata basis up to the amount of USDL outstanding on a 1:1 basis to US dollars. Such funds (up to the USDL outstanding amount) are not permitted to be paid to any other party including any creditor of Paxos International, nor is any USDL holder entitled to any additional yield in such an event.

6. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?

No, Paxos International does not have any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers.

7. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO

To our knowledge, Paxos International or the USDL product does not have any identified conflicts of interest with MakerDAO.

8. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product

Paxos International recommends consulting with a tax advisor regarding the potential tax implications associated with USDL.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark

Paxos International believes that the relevant benchmark for USDL would be the risk-free rate for the US Dollar. The general market consensus is that the risk-free rate for the US Dollar is a zero-coupon US Treasury security, i.e., a one year (52-week) US Treasury Bill. This can be independently obtained via TreasuryDirect at https://www.treasurydirect.gov/auctions/auction-query/.

Since the launch of USDL, the APY on USDL has closely approximated the risk-free rate given the composition of the underlying reserves.

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these?

Paxos International has engaged Crowe MAK, a global audit, tax, advisory and risk firm to perform the monthly examination of USDL’s reserves in accordance with guidelines as set forth by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (“FSRA”) of the Abu Dhabi Global Market (“ADGM”). Reports are issued monthly and posted to Lift Dollar (USDL) - Access Restricted.

Since inception, USDL’s APY has approximated 5%.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product

Paxos International has engaged Crowe MAK, a global audit, tax, advisory and risk firm to perform the monthly examination of USDL’s reserves in accordance with guidelines as set forth by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (“FSRA”) of the Abu Dhabi Global Market (“ADGM”). Crowe is an independent-third party with both the knowledge and experience to perform the examination engagement.

As part of Crowe’s monthly examinations, they ensure that the fair value and the amortized cost of the reserve assets is at equal to or greater than the total outstanding market capitalization of USDL at the time of the examination. Crowe’s examinations are performed in accordance with the standards set forth by the International Auditing and Assurance Standards Board.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product

The USDL token is deployed on the Ethereum network and is centrally minted/burned by Paxos International. USDL and the associated smart contract provide yield through a daily rebasing mechanism. Rebasing is a technique used to adjust the supply of a token. The USDL smart contract uses rebasing, through a smart-contract multiplier, to distribute yield to eligible token holders. All eligible token balances increase based on the multiplier value.

Deploying this smart contract on the Ethereum blockchain enables transparent and programmatic yield distribution. It also allows yield to be distributed to a large number of wallets regardless of the amount being distributed. Rebasing occurs at a set interval, for example, at the same time every day. Eligible token holders see their balance increase as a result of rebasing at these set time intervals. USDL is configured to rebase daily at launch, though this frequency could change in the future to address customer needs.

For more information on the USDL technical implementation, please see our white paper at https://whitepaper.liftdollar.com/index.html

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

The USDL smart contract is audited by both Certik and Trail of Bits to ensure that the code is sound and operates as intended. The most recent audits were completed in Q1 2024. Audits are publicly viewable on github https://github.com/paxosglobal/ybs-contract/tree/master/audits.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs

Paxos has previously worked on direct listings with platforms such Aave and Compound, as well as incentive programs with MakerDAO PSM.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?

The SparkDAO/MakerDAO allocation to USDL will help give these ecosystems direct access to competitive yield in a transparent and conservative manner. Due to USDL’s prudential oversight by the FSRA, USDL’s stablecoin reserves may only be held in the most secure and liquid assets which include cash deposits at regulated financial institutions, short-term US Government Securities and US Government Money Market Funds. Further, USDL’s reserves will be examined monthly by an independent third-party to ensure that USDL is adequately reserves. The results of this examination will be published monthly by Paxos International.

In addition to tokenized assets such as USDL, onboarding to Paxos International will give SparkDAO/MakerDAO access to Paxos’ asset orchestration platform. This enables the seamless movement between stablecoins (including USDL, PYUSD, USDC, USDP, and USDT).

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

USDL is relatively new but we plan to introduce integrations on platforms such as Morpho and Aave in the coming weeks.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

In addition to USDL, Paxos is also the issuer of:

  • PAXG, a regulated tokenized gold product. With a market capitalization of ~$500M.

  • PYUSD, PayPal’s regulated stablecoin. Current market capitalization of $850M.

    • We can offer a revenue share on the amount of PYUSD adopted by SparkDAO

  • USDP, Paxos’ original regulated stablecoin. Current market capitalization of $105M.

    • We can offer a revenue share on the amount of USDP adopted by SparkDAO

Paxos is open to partnerships and potential revenue sharing opportunities on these products as well. We also expect to tokenize other assets as the leading regulated tokenization for platforms like Paypal, and can explore future opportunities when they arise.

item.title: First Wave Integrator Program - FAQ
item.dc:creator: Viridian
item.description:
Following on from the First Wave Integrator Program introductory post, this guide has been created by Viridian Advisors to assist applicants in understanding the details of the Accessibility Reward system. Viridian Advisors is an Atlas-appointed operator of the Accessibility Reward Codes. Whether you’re an Integrator, user, or stakeholder, our aim is to make the process more transparent and help you navigate the opportunities available.

Viridian Advisors is solely responsible for the content of this FAQ, ensuring that all information provided here is accurate and up-to-date. Note that the final decisions regarding the First Wave Integrator Program and Accessibility Rewards, in general, will always be made by the Sky Ecosystem Governance. To learn more about our role, read the relevant provisions of the Atlas [link]. If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to us directly.

Program

  1. What is the First Wave Integrator program ?
  2. Who is eligible to apply ?
  3. What’s the application process ?
  4. Will there be other Sky integrator programs beyond the First Wave program ?

Integrators

  1. What are the main rules ?
  2. How are integrators selected ?
  3. Are there any ongoing operational requirements for integrators ?
  4. Are there any geographical or other restrictions for integrators ?

Technical

  1. What are the technical integration requirements of the program ?
  2. What technical support is available for integration efforts ?
  3. What data (e.g., addresses, reports, metrics ) needs to be tracked / provided ?
  4. How are transactions tagged with the Accessibility Reward Code ?
  5. Is the First Wave program available Multichain (i.e. beyond Ethereum Mainnet) ?

Operational

  1. How long is the process to be approved for the program ?
  2. How are accessibility rewards calculated and received ?
  3. Can an accessibility reward code be issued to facilitate integration efforts prior to acceptance to the program ?

1) What is the First Wave Integrator program ?

The First Wave Integrator Program allows projects in the crypto ecosystem that integrate USDS to get Accessibility Rewards, subject to the relevant terms.

Integrators should refer to Information for USDS integrators for further background on the USDS stablecoin.

Accessibility Rewards is a feature of the Sky Protocol. Viridian Advisors acts as the Accessibility Reward Codes operator.

2) Who is eligible to apply ?

As Viridian Advisors, we are open to projects across the ecosystem including segments such as L1’s, L2’s, Wallets, Exchanges, dApps, and Consumer applications.

Note that the final decisions regarding availability will be made by Sky Ecosystem Governance. The First Wave Integrator Program is in its early phases, and its rules will develop and become more comprehensive over time. We encourage applicants to contact us but note that eligibility and geographical restrictions will apply.

3) What’s the application process?

Applications should be made via the First Wave Integrator Program post in the Sky Ecosystem Governance forum or directly via the following google form.

All applications will be reviewed by Viridian Advisors on their individual merits against the program selection criteria and for those projects being considered for inclusion, the listed contact in the application process will be contacted by us to coordinate next steps. As noted above, final decisions regarding eligibility and participation in the program will be made by Sky Ecosystem Governance in a discretionary manner.

4) Will there be other Sky integrator programs beyond the First Wave program ?

It is expected that over time, the Sky Integrator Program will encompass more than just the First Wave Program. The final decisions in this respect belong to Sky Ecosystem Governance.

As such, non-inclusion in the First Wave Integrator Program by Viridian Advisors does not exclude potential future inclusion in a Sky integrator program and future access to Accessibility Rewards.

5) What are the main rules ?

Integrators included in the program will be issued an Accessibility Reward Code, which will allow them to earn Accessibility Rewards on USDS balances that access the Sky protocol via the Integrator front ends or infrastructure.

The accessibility rewards are specified and maintained updated within the Accessibility Scope of the Atlas v2 ,

Pursuant to the latest Sky Ecosystem Governance proposal update, Integrators earn a 0.4% annual adoption-based incentive on USDS balances held in the Sky Savings Rate or Sky Token Rewards features of the Sky Protocol.

For USDS balances outside of the Sky Savings Rate or Sky Token Rewards, Integrators earn an annual adoption-based incentive fee equal to [Sky Savings Rate - 0.2%].

6) How are integrators selected ?

Projects will be initially reviewed by Viridian Advisors against criteria, including having an active and live product, community reach, segment focus and strategic alignment with the Sky money ecosystem.

As Viridian Advisors, we will prioritize those Integrators who demonstrate commitment and the agility to integrate USDS in a timely manner following launch.

7) Are there any ongoing operational requirements for integrators ?

The Accessibility Scope of the Atlas v2., governs accessibility efforts, including the Accessibility Reward system, and integrators should stay abreast of updates implemented by Sky Ecosystem Governance to this scope.

8) Are there any geographical or other restrictions for integrators ?

As a decentralized and permissionless protocol, the Sky Protocol itself, including the contracts for its native stablecoin, USDS, and native governance token, SKY, have no inherent jurisdictional restrictions.

Integrator interfaces that serve as gateways to the Sky Protocol may implement access restrictions in light of any applicable regulatory considerations. However, these restrictions are specific to those interfaces and do not reflect any jurisdictional restrictions imposed by the Sky Protocol itself as the Sky Protocol is permissionless software that can be accessed via the blockchain.

The location resilience article within the Accessibility Scope defines the location-filtering rules applicable for integrator frontends that receive Accessibility Rewards. Any infringement to the restrictions in this article may result in the loss of access to Accessibility Rewards.

While we expect the Atlas rules regarding Accessibility Rewards to be elaborated in the future, as Viridian Advisors, we will aim to accept participants who comply with the rules and requirements as specified in the Atlas. Participants based out of or serving customers in highly regulated or regulatorily uncertain countries will likely be excluded from participation. Feel free to clarify your regulatory position when applying to the program.

9) What are the technical integration requirements of the program ?

Integrators will need to support USDS via their front end or infrastructure.

At least one of the USDS features of the Sky Protocol , i.e., USDS Unrewarded, USDS Savings or USDS Token Rewards will need to be integrated to qualify for receiving Accessibility Rewards.

First Wave Program Integrators will be issued an Accessibility Reward Code, which will allow them to tag USDS balances and user transactions that access the Sky Protocol.

10) What technical support is available for integration efforts ?

The technical developer documentation, available at https://docs.sky.money/developers/yFbKYQfnTPVv36vJZ3OK should be the first port of call.

Additionally, for First Wave Program members, on a best effort basis, technical support can be provided by relevant Sky Ecosystem Actors.

11) What data (e.g., addresses, reports, metrics) needs to be tracked/provided ?

All Integrators should provide an Ethereum address for receiving their Accessibility Reward.

In cases where custodial addresses exist for USDS and/or sUSDS balances, they should be provided.

Transactions calling the relevant contracts of the Sky Protocol for USDS Savings and for USDS Token Rewards should be tagged with the Accessibility Reward Code issued to the Integrator.

Where on-chain monitoring is not viable, off-chain reports / metrics may be requested, such as aggregated user balances for USDS.

At the time of issuance of the Accessibility Reward Code, the exact data to be provided for monitoring purposes will be reviewed and confirmed with each integrator.

12) How are transactions tagged with the Accessibility Reward Code ?

Integrators should tag USDS Savings and USDS Token Rewards Transactions with their unique Accessibility Reward Code as per the following links;

  • USDS Savings contract ( link )

  • USDS Token Rewards contract ( link )

13) Is the First Wave Program available Multichain (i.e., beyond Ethereum Mainnet) ?

Initially the First Wave Program will only launch on mainnet, and accessibility rewards for USDS on other domains can only be credited to the Reward Code holder of any qualifying bridge contract.

Once Skylink launches and supports other domains, starting with L2’s, Accessibility Rewards will be available directly for L2 and other domain integrators, since Skylink infra will facilitate the tracking of individual integrator activity on other domains.

14) How long is the process to be approved for the program ?

There are no defined or limiting timeframes, neither for application nor for processing, although best efforts will be made to respond to all applicants in a timely manner and for the processing of Accessibility Reward Codes.

The program should be considered as ongoing and continuous and also subject to change over time via Sky Ecosystem Governance updates to the Accessibility Scope in the Atlas.

15) How are accessibility rewards calculated and received ?

Accessibility rewards are calculated on a monthly basis based on the rates defined within the Accessibility Scope of the Atlas v2 ;

Rewards will be calculated and published by Viridian Advisors using available on chain data of USDS and/or sUSDS balances , as well as Accessibility Reward Code tagged transactions. Where applicable off-chain reports and data may also be used.

Integrator rewards will be disbursed by the Accessibility Scope Facilitator to the Ethereum wallet corresponding to the registered Integrator, subject to approval from Sky Ecosystem Governance.

Note that the rules are subject to change as the program evolves. Any detected unwanted behavior to misuse the program may cause exclusion from the program without notice, or refusal to pay out the rewards.

16) Can an Accessibility Reward Code be pre-issued to facilitate integration efforts prior to inclusion in the program?

In some cases, where inclusion in the First Wave Program may be delayed, an accessibility reward code may be pre-issued to allow integrators to proceed with their integration efforts and so allow for the retroactive calculation of Accessibility Rewards when and if inclusion in the program is eventually approved.

In such cases, the issuance of an Accessibility Reward Code should not be interpreted as an inclusion to receive Accessibility Rewards, which will only be disbursed following approval into the program and based on the Participant lists published on the Sky Ecosystem Governance forum.

I. Product Summary

Project name : Cogito Finance

Product name : TFUND

Product type / underlying asset : Product Type : Tokenized Fund, Underlying Asset : Blackrock iShares 0-3 Month Treasury Bond ETF (SGOV)

Issuer jurisdiction : Cayman Islands

Product website - www.cogito.finance

Primary contact name, title, and method of contact

  • Primary Contact Name : Cloris Chen
  • Title : CEO
  • Method of Contact : cloris@cogito.finance(Email), @clorisxchen (Telegram)

II. Company Details

Company description

Cogito Finance provides institutional-grade investment products by bringing fixed-income assets and equities onchain. Through tokenization, Cogito addresses challenges in DeFi, such as unsustainable yield farming, credit risk, and regulatory uncertainty. As a SingularityNET ecosystem partner, Cogito leverages Ben Goertzel’s expertise to implement Artificial Intelligence in its processes, including portfolio management.

Key personnel biographies

Cloris Chen - CEO

Cloris combines a banking background with hands-on DeFi experience. She spent 6 years at HSBC and served as treasury director for a unicorn startup. She holds a Master’s in CS from UPenn and a Master’s in Economics from HKUST.

Norton Wang - CTO

Norton has over 10 years of blockchain engineering experience at startups like TradeBlock, Axoni, and DFINITY. He has worked on everything from Bitcoin script to enterprise blockchains to market making bots. He holds a CS degree from Cornell University

Nejc Znidar - Co-Founder & Chief Quant

Nejc has extensive experience as a financial modeler and analyst and has contributed to various research areas at SingularityNET in the last 7 years. He worked as a data scientist in Zalando, biggest German online fashion retailer before that… He holds a Master’s in Quantitative Science from Tilburg University.

Kenneth Ng - Head of BD

Kenneth is a seasoned sales professional with a background in reputable companies such as crypto.com and the TON Foundation. He holds a BBA in Finance and Information Systems from HKUST.

Sandra Grabowiec - Communications & Partnerships Lead

Sandra’s blockchain journey began in 2018 when she focused on smart contracts in her dissertation to later pursue a Master’s Degree in Blockchain and Digital Currency from UNIC. Her hands-on experience in DeFi, business consultancy, and education reflects her passion for the blockchain and fintech landscape.

LC Stroud - Content Strategist

LC is an experienced marketing strategist with a vast portfolio of clients across both Web2 and Web3, namely Longines and Ajax FC. Throughout her years in the field, she’s delved into various blockchain topics, including DeFi protocols, decentralization, and regulatory aspects. She studied at University of Nicosia under Andreas Antonopoulos and holds certificates in ‘Introduction to Decentralized Finance (DeFi)’ and ‘Blockchain Technology and Digital Currency’.

Team size

8 members

Years in operation

2 years

III. Product Information

Describe the product

TFUND, is a fund product offered by Cogito that invests in short-term U.S. treasury bills. The fund is issued under a CIMA licensed SPC registered in the Cayman Islands.

Our operational setup enables us to facilitate 24/7 subscriptions and redemptions in FIAT our stablecoin with a maximum lead time of two business days.

Upon KYC completion, investors are provided with access to Cogito’s investment dashboard where they could easily subscribe and redeem TFUND. The dashboard also provides the investor with various account management tools to view their balance, managing personal information and wallet addresses.

Please see below for a screenshot of the investor dashboard.

Describe the underlying asset

TFUND primarily invests in Blackrock iShares 0-3 Month Treasury Bond ETF (Ticker : SGOV). The fund may hold some assets in stablecoins to facilitate quick redemptions for operational efficiency

  • SGOV Fact Sheet
  • SGOV Prospectus

The investment objective of the Fund is to achieve returns and capital appreciation. Hence, the fund also has the flexibility to hold stablecoins, cash or cash equivalents for various purposes.

How is yield transferred to the tokenholder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

The yield is transferred to the tokenholder through price accrual. The price of TFUND is updated whenever there is a change in the funds NAV (Net Asset Value). It is also important to note that investors would be able to easily view these changes through the Cogito’s dashboard alongside NAV reports specially circulated for the investor.

What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

Issuer : Ergo Sum SPC, a company incorporated with limited liability and registered as a segregated portfolio company under the laws of the Cayman Islands, registered with CIMA under registration no. 403321

Investment Manager: Ergo Sum Management Ltd, registered with the BVI Financial Services Commission as an Approved Manager pursuant to the BVI Investment Business (Approved Managers) Regulations, 2012

What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?

The primary underlying asset for TFUND is Blackrock iShares 0-3 Month Treasury Bond ETF (SGOV).

Cogito may also choose to invest into other relevant assets for TFUND (i.e directly in TBills, funds or other ETFs) without any concentration limits in order to achieve the fund’s investment objective.

In order to facilitate this, Cogito has implemented a thorough due diligence process and will only invest with reputable companies, and counterparties.

Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?

Not permitted

Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

Counterparty / Service Provider Scope of Service Website

DavisPolk Legal - HK Counsel https://www.davispolk.com/
